msDesc.head: Albertus Magnus, De mysterio missae; Ps.-Augustine, Manuale; Ps.- Bernard of Clairvaux, Meditationes. Germany (Mainz Charterhouse?), s. xiv2/4.

msItem.note: This description is abbreviated from Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue (Oxford, 2018), pp. 991–996. For purposes of scholarly citation, reference to the printed catalogue is requested.

msItem.author: Albertus Magnus
msItem.title: De mysterio missae
msItem.note: Abbreviated version: part 1 (ed.: Glorieux, Rép., 6ca; ZKTh 82 (1960) 1–39; C.A.L.M.A. I. 132, Albert 47, no. 100).

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Manuale
msItem.note: Preface (shortened), cap. 1–17 (ed.: PL 40. 951–59 = PL 177. 171A–79D; Glorieux, Migne, 28; PLS 2. 1366; Römer ii/1. 122 (no. 17); ii/2. 276; Bloomfield 4957, and suppl.; CPPM 2. 3074).

msItem.author: Ps.-Bernard of Clairvaux
msItem.title: Meditationes piissimae
msItem.note: Binding error, with the text ending on fol. 42v and continuing on fol. 47v–r (ed.: PL 184. 485A–508B; Glorieux, Migne, 71; Leclercq, Études, 12; Bloomfield 3126, and suppl.; BGOC 18. 7229).
Two short sermons in Ps 79:15, anonymous.

supportDesc.support: parchment; (fol. 21) remnants of medieval repair (stitching holes).
supportDesc.extent: ii (17th cent.) + 49 + ii (17th cent.) leaves c.171–77 111–25
supportDesc.collation: i and ii 8 | iii 10 | iv and v 8 | vi 6+1. Binding error: fol. 47 inserted at end of last quire (with script upside-down), instead of verso following fol. 42v at beginning of last quire.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in ink, one column of 33 lines. Ruled space c.130–34 90–93

handDesc.handNote: German textualis, s. xiv2/4, by a single hand. (Item 5) Bastarda, s. xv, in a Carthusian hand from Mainz. (Items 2 and 4) Hands of s. xivex and s. xv from the Mainz Charterhouse added titles.

decoDesc.decoNote: Unfilled spaces for initials and rubrication.

binding.p: Limp parchment case binding for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639

origin.origPlace: Germany, possibly at the Mainz Charterhouse

history.provenance: Mainz, Carthusian abbey of St Michael: the 15th-cent. ex-libris inscriptions at the upper right- hand margin of fol. 1r: ‘fratrum Cartusiensium Maguncie’ and, in a different hand, at the upper margin of fol. 46v: ‘Codex Carthusiensium moguncie’.
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. ii verso.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: See above. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 252 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 51

listBibl.head: Published descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Daniela Mairhofer, Medieval Manuscripts from the Mainz Charterhouse in the Bodleian Library, Oxford: A Descriptive Catalogue, 2 vols. (Oxford, 2018), pp. 991–996

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project to include additional information from Mairhofer catalogue.
